data.title: Retirement Compensation Arrangement (RCA)
data.description: On January 1, 2022, the existing Public Service Supplementary Benefits Account (PSSBA) was replaced by a new RCA which provides additional tax benefits and portability options for members.

data.title: New Definition of Eligible Child
data.description: A recent amendment to the Public Service Pension Plan (PSPP) changed the definition of 'eligible child' to allow eligible disabled dependant children to receive a lifetime survivor pension even if the child is over 18 and not attending post secondary school.

data.title: Upcoming Mailing to Members
data.description: On July 4, 2000, the attached Pension Bulletins #4 and #5 will be mailed to members of the Public Service Pension Plan.

data.title: Planning for Retirement in Mid-Career
data.description: Mid-career tends to be when people start paying attention to their retirement plan. Learn more about how to plan for your retirement in mid-career.

data.title: Planning for Retirement in Late Career
data.description: For many members, the final ten or so years of work prior to retirement is an exciting time to start looking forward to what lies after that important date. Learn what you need to be paying attention to in Late Career in order to have a successful retirement.

data.title: OPB News for Retired Members
data.description: OPBnews

data.title: OPB News for Retired Members
data.description: OPBnews

data.title: OPB News for Members
data.description: OPBnews

data.title: Insured benefits
data.description: If you meet certain eligibility criteria, you may receive certain insured medical benefits in retirement.

breadcrums.name: Making the most of your retirement

data.title: Estate planning
data.description: If you're creating or refining your estate plan don't forget to include your pension. OPB's Advisors are Certified Financial Planners who can assist you.

data.title: Survivor benefits to protect your loved ones
data.description: It’s important to be aware of the PSPP's survivor benefits and how they can support your loved ones after you pass away.

data.title: Starting or ending a relationship in retirement
data.description: Whether you're ending or beginning a relationship, it's important to understand how these life changes may impact your PSPP pension.

data.title: Managing your taxes
data.description: Retirement comes with distinct tax advantages and responsibilities that you must be aware of, especially if you want to minimize your tax liabilities.

data.title: CPP integration
data.description: CPP integration refers to how the PSPP and CPP plans work together during a member's working years, early retirement, and after age 65.

data.title: Overview
data.description: Whether you're a retired member or a surviving spouse/beneficiary, there's some critical information you need to know about your pension benefits.

data.title: Defined benefit plans 101
data.description: A defined benefit plan provides you with a pension that’s payable for your lifetime so you don’t need to worry about outliving your money in retirement.

breadcrums.name: Why your DB pension is important

data.title: Open information sessions are here
data.description: Learning about the Public Service Pension Plan (PSPP) will help you make informed decisions about your pension. And now, you no longer have to wait until a session takes place where you work.

data.title: Pension application process
data.description: An overview of pension application process.

data.title: Retirement administration
data.description: Overview of the mechanics related to pension payments; i.e., pension formula, payment dates, CPP integration

data.title: Surviving spouse and beneficiaries
data.description: An overview of topics related to surviving spouses & beneficiaries.

data.title: Post-retirement death
data.description: Overview of the topics related to a member's post-retirement death.

data.title: Pre-retirement death
data.description: Overview page related to pre-retirement death.

data.title: Designating beneficiaries
data.description: Overview of topics related to designating pension beneficiaries.

data.title: Terminating PSPP membership
data.description: Learn more about the different reasons that can cause an employee's PSPP membership to be terminated.

data.title: Transfers
data.description: The introductory page for the Employer Manual section related to reciprocal transfer agreements (RTAs).

data.title: Tools to help you meet your goals
data.description: OPB provides members with free online tools so you can forecast everything from your potential pension income to your complete financial retirement picture.

data.title: About your pension
data.description: As a member of the Public Service Pension Plan (the PSPP or the Plan), there is some information you need to know to understand how pensions fit into your overall retirement plan.

data.title: Designating or changing beneficiaries
data.description: Your pension may be one of your most significant assets and it comes with valuable survivor benefits to help protect your loved ones when you pass away.

data.title: Retirement forms
data.description: To help you officially start retirement, there are forms you need to review and fill out including some you'll see mentioned in your retirement package.

data.title: Publications
data.description: summary

data.title: Divestment
data.description: Divestment is the term used within the Ontario Public Service (OPS) to describe a sale, assignment or disposal of an operation from the Ontario government, or one of its agencies, boards or commissions to other government or private sector employers, or vice-versa. We've prepared this section to help you to understand how divestments are treated in the PSPP.

data.title: Death
data.description: Overview of topics related to the death of a PSPP member or retired member.

data.title: Glossary
data.description: Terms and words relating to the administration and advocacy of the Public Service Pension Plan.

data.title: Forms
data.description: Here you will find a listing of our commonly used forms.

data.title: Site map
data.description: Site map for www.opb.ca

data.title: Separation or divorce
data.description: Because your pension is considered a family asset, it's important to understand how it's affected when you start, or end, a spousal relationship.

data.title: Updating member information
data.description: Scenarios where employers must notify OPB about any member information changes..

data.title: Get a Start on Retirement Planning
data.description: We’re here to help take the stress out of retirement planning so that you can start retirement dreaming.

data.title: Retirement Planning
data.description: Retirement used to be simple. You’d work one job for your entire career and then you announced your retirement and went on to live happily with your employer sponsored pension.

data.title: Plan Your Retirement with OPB
data.description: November is Financial Literacy Month and what better time to discuss one of our favourite topics: Retirement planning.

data.title: Staying Socially and Physically Active in Retirement
data.description: After a rewarding career, retirement gives you the gift of time.

data.title: OPB News for Members
data.description: In this year's edition of OPB News, we want to provide helpful tips and information you can use for your financial and retirement planning.

data.title: What’s your OPB retirement story?
data.description: In our 2019 issue of OPB News for Retired Members, we asked our retired members to submit a photo of how they are staying active in retirement.

data.title: Your PSPP Pension & Your Retirement
data.description: As a member of the PSPP, you might be thinking “why do I need to focus on retirement when my pension’s got me covered?”

data.title: RRSPs vs TFSA: Which is more effective in enhancing my retirement income?
data.description: As you plan for your retirement, you may be wondering about the best way to make your money work for you.

data.title: Mark Fuller: Sharing responsibility for creating a sustainable retirement system in Canada
data.description: On December 10, 2015, President & CEO Mark Fuller spoke to the Actuarial Standards Oversight Council about the challenges the Canadian retirement system is facing.

data.title: Availability of post-retirement insured benefits optional upgrade packages
data.description: Retired members and survivors who qualify for post-retirement insured benefits will be eligible to enrol in an additional optional upgrade package starting in August 2017.

data.title: Is early retirement right for you?
data.description: Not so long ago, the dream of retiring with a pension seemed very simple.

data.title: See how using e-services helps you plan for and manage your retirement
data.description: As a member of the Public Service Pension Plan, you can register for e-services – OPB’s online member portal – to help you actively plan for and manage your retirement.

data.title: OPB News for Members
data.description: Read the latest news for Members.

data.title: Canadian defined benefit pension plans collaborate on retirement security video to mark Financial Literacy Month
data.description: Defined benefit (DB) pension plans from across Canada today released an informational video entitled What’s Important produced in collaboration to mark Financial Literacy Month and raise awareness about the value of retirement income security.

data.title: Post-retirement benefits premium rate changes effective June 1, 2019 for retirees
data.description: The Government of Ontario has announced changes to the premium rates for the Ontario Public Service (OPS) Post-Retirement Benefit (PRB) plans (where applicable), and for the Optional Upgrade Package (OUP) for eligible retired members that will be effective June 1, 2019.
